messages.title: The most important election of our lifetime?
messages.content: This year's General Election will be one of the most pivotal Britain has faced in generations.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Deliver more school places for the next generation and encourage aspiration
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secured £47 million to provide more school places locally and confirmed a new primary school. I will also contribute to fighting for a new secondary school as well as for local teachers to be recognised in the honours list.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Tackle crime and anti-social behaviour, with a zero-tolerance approach to domestic abuse
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Crime in our area has reduced by over 16%, but there is more to do. Following a London Domestic Abuse summit I organised in Chiswick, the Home Secretary has announced £10 million funds to support victims of domestic abuse. I will continue to prioritise that locally.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Increase the number of apprenticeships for young people and encourage new small businesses
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Local youth unemployment is down by over 40%, over 2,600 new businesses and more than 800 apprenticeships started. I will ensure businesses have the support they need and young people the opportunities they deserve.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Provide more affordable homes for local people and the services to go with them
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will make clear the commitment and availability for affordable housing as part of all future developments and for local people.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Take action to improve our streets and local transport
keyPolicies.policyDescription: While we’ve seen investments like the Cycle Superhighway and improvements to local stations, there is more to do like reducing aircraft noise and improving air quality.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight against a 3rd and 4th runway at Heathrow and a reduction in night flights
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I have led local campaigns against night flights and expansion at Heathrow because of the detrimental impact on our local community.

issues.economy: Britain growing faster than any economy in Europe
issues.education: 1 million more children being taught in good or outstanding schools
issues.immigration: Reduces the benefit cap to £23,000 a year for out of work household, no benefits for EU migrants anywhere in Europe
issues.socialWelfare: Benefits capped at £26,000 a year; Making sure work always pays

housing.content: Provide more affordable homes for local people and the services to go with them

leaflet.additionalNotes: Find out more about the Conservatives’ long-term economic plan for Britain facebook.com/conservatives
